ComicInfo.Title: No. 368; Fables of Freddy: How Hashish Got Its Name; Upstairs, Downstairs Motor Home Conversion; #115 [Defective Cars and Incompetent Drivers]; #113 The Urban Equalizer; #149 [The Hurry Tax]; #178 [Wearing Out Their Cars]; No. 275 This Week: London; The French Push; No. 111 Honk Therapy; #682 Places Of Particular Automotive Interest; France
ComicInfo.Summary:
Fat Freddy has some wild dreams.
All about the Citroen 2CV.
How to convert a bus into a home.
How to deal with incompetent drivers.
The ideal car for the offensive driver.
Why not pay to change a red light?
Cars aren't being worn out as fast as they should be.
A look at London traffic.
How friendly French drivers help the 2CV along.
How to honk effectively.
A look at French cars
Fat Freddy tries to teach an old cat a new trick.
How cats spray grafitti.
The old days
There's an intruder in the house.
Another mess on the floor.
Why cats are pets.
The cat is offered a job.
The cat performs a rescue.
A new racket.
Fat Freddy tries to hypnotise his cat.
